definition: former prime minister
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang

sentences.english: On the following day, Crawley went to the house again.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，帕特里克再次來到前首相的住處。

sentences.english: He is the first fromer prime minister in Israel to face criminal charges.
sentences.chinese: 這使他成爲第一個面臨刑事訴訟的以色列前首相。

sentences.english: The prime minister fixes me with a self-consciously stern gaze.
sentences.chinese: 前首相自然而然地用嚴厲的目光盯着我。

sentences.english: The former prime minister has been entirely disowned.
sentences.chinese: 這位前首相卻完全否認此事。

sentences.english: Ex-British prime minister Tony Blair was among those who recorded a video greeting.
sentences.chinese: 英國前首相布萊爾也爲演唱會錄製了一段視頻祝詞。

definition: prime minister (of Japan or UK etc)
KOIZUMI Jun'ichirō (1942-), Japanese LDP politician, prime minister 2001-2006
Hatoyama Yukio (1947-), Japanese Democratic Party politician, prime minister 2009-2010
Mrs Thatcher/Baroness Thatcher or Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013), British conservative politician, prime minister 1979-1990
Abe Shinzo (1954-), Japanese LDP politician, prime minister 2006-2007 and from 2012
Cameron (name)
former prime minister
Thatcher (name)/Baroness Thatcher or Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013), British conservative politician, prime minister 1979-1990
member of congress/congressman
Foreign Secretary/(UK) Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs
MORI Yoshirō (1937-), Japanese rugby player and politician, prime minister 2000-2001, famous for numerous gaffes
KAIFU Toshiki (1931-), Japanese politician, prime minister 1989-1991
Noda Yoshihiko, Prime Minister of Japan (2 September 2011 ~)
faction leader/head of political party
Abe (Japanese surname)
FUKUDA Yasuo (1936-), Japanese LDP politician, prime minister 2007-2008
